WRITING.TEXT: Don't sell yourself short! I bet it's wonderful.
Have you heard of zentangles? What you're describing sounds like that. It's a really neat art style.
he looks like a great doggo to snuggle with.
happy St. pupper's day to the good boy!
b r a v e b o y e. be safe pupper!

WRITING.TITLE: g o o d g i r l e doing a snooze

WRITING.TEXT: I totally get it. I get all the feels when I get stoned. I don't have to put up a front and it's great, as long as I'm with good friends.
Can confirm. 60 pound lab thinks she's a lap dog. She's the best though. Labs are such good dogs.

You inspired my love of science as a child. . I'm now 19 and working towards an astrophysics degree. That being said, if you could do any experiment IN space, what would it be? Also, what is one myth you never tested that you wish you could have?
You're cool as hell and I wish you the best! Keep on inspiring, mr. Savage!
This made my day.

Thank you for doing what you do and being so level headed!The one time I had to call 911 I know I was hysterical and the operator was very helpful and was obviously doing her best in a confusing and messy situation.
When I called 911, it was for a suicide in progress I was calling in. It was a volatile situation and the operator didn't want me near the house. I asked if she'd stay on the phone with me until the sheriff called me and she did. Is that something you're obligated to do? It meant a lot to me and I wish I could thank her.
good luck to you. I can't imagine how difficult this is but I am so proud. a month is a big deal and I hope you keep going. stay strong. you have so much too look forward to. I'm always here to talk.
Hell yeah. Good on you. I hope you're well.

WRITING.TITLE: Hemiplegic migraines - anyone else got them?
WRITING.TEXT: I've been dealing with migraines for three years now and I was finally diagnosed with hemiplegic migraines in August. Next week I go see a specialist to see what we can do to treat them. Does anyone else have this diagnosis? If so, how are you dealing with them? Any advice?
congratulations! that's a huge deal. what are you looking forward to doing in this new chapter in life? I wish you luck.
That makes me angry to hear. I am so sorry. I hope you're doing well.
I'll have to try it out.
I've been in therapy for a few years. I might bring it up. Thank you.

WRITING.TITLE: Recently started smoking weed. Feels great, but I have one problem.
WRITING.TEXT:
I've been dealing with major anxiety, depression, and PTSD for several years now. I've been on Xanax, Remeron, Ativan, and nothing has helped. I recently started smoking with a really close friend of mine. After a hit or two, I feel good. My anxiety starts to lessen, I feel more relaxed. However, as soon as the high starts to fade, I feel really depressed. The first time, I thought it was just me having a bad day, but it happens every time.
I feel really safe with the person I'm smoking with, so they aren't the problem. Last night, we hung out and got really high. I was pretty good for about an hour, almost two. Then I started to get really depressed and super anxious. I don't know what is going on. I was wondering if any of you could help me out. Is this a thing?
You are a very good person. She's lucky to have gotten such a good home.
Congratulations! That's a huge achievement. I'm a year into anorexia recovery myself. I wish you all the best in your journey.
That's unbelievably frustrating. Good luck!
Some buyers will buy enough product that the dealer has to buy more product, putting them at a higher risk. Some addicts don't pay up. None of it makes sense. It's a sick business.
Congratulations on recovery! I'm glad you are in a better place!

Some do. Fentanyl can be used as a prescription pain killer. Getting prescriptions to feed an addiction isn't easy. It's so potent that a small amount gets you high, so it's not profitable to a dealer.
Oh man. That's awful. Something needs to be done.
Yeah, it is. I have a friend in Ohio that has been to three funerals in 2 months.

Some addicts use a lot. Some dealers can't keep up with the amount of product 1 person is buying in relation to the rest of their buyers. It's a shady business. It gets cut to be cheaper. Fent is cheaper than heroin so it brings the cost down for a stronger high.
Had a cousin use suboxene to get off morphine. Started abusing suboxene. Methadone and the like are glorified/legal street drugs.
Ohio and Connecticut are getting hit hard, too. Sarasota County in Florida is, as well.

It's about 100x stronger too. So a user takes a normal dose, they OD. So an addict gets some cheap dope, they shoot it, they OD. Some dealers use it to 'get rid' of needy buyers. Some dealers don't even know it's cut. They just sell the dope and end up killing someone. It's a huge problem.

WRITING.TITLE: Finally opening up about my assault in therapy... [trigger warning]
WRITING.TEXT:
I was assaulted two years ago by an abusive (now ex) boyfriend. I've told a few people about it, but only the fact that I was assaulted. No other details. This Wednesday, I finally started to open up a little more to my therapist about it. I started to get really upset and kind of dissociated from the topic and my therapist noticed pretty quickly. I told her the shame that I feel about it makes it hard to talk about.
I was 16 when it happened. He was 19. I was at a very vulnerable time in my life and he made things seem okay. We dated for about 6 months. During those 6 months, the abuse progressed from slight manipulation, to insults, threats, screaming at me, and then it got physical. I will not go into much more detail, but the assault was violent. It has been two years and he still follows me around town. My parents are his bosses. They do not know. It is best for everyone involved if they don't.
I was talking to my therapist about the shame. It isn't just the shame of being taken advantage of, but the shame of how my body reacted. My brain wanted nothing to do with it. I could not defend myself. My body was not on the same page. I climaxed. He took notice and it got more aggressive and he got more verbal. After, he made threats ("tell anyone and i'll do it again", "i can and will hurt you", etc) and then went back to his 'normal' self. He was very tender after and I was confused.
The shame I feel talking about it prevents me from talking about it. I do not know how to handle the shame. Does anyone have advice about how to cope? It sits inside me like poison and I just feel worse.
I have a lot of family and friends in EMS. This is heart wrenching. My heart breaks for you. I hope you're doing alright. Thank you for doing this difficult job.

My best friend is a paranoid schizophrenic. He's been getting worse the last few months. His psychiatrist doesn't care. He's on meds that make him a completely different person. He's not lucid. His psychiatrist doesn't give a single shit. His dosages are all sorts of crazy. He's feeling anxious? Take him off his schizophrenia meds, add anti anxiety. Oh, now he's paranoid and sleeping in a park? Just let the anxiety meds work.
Thank you for showing compassion to your patient. Schizophrenia is a horrible disease.

Just wanted to say you seem like a lovely person. I wish you well in life.
What is your favorite movie? Do you have a favorite planet?
That man is a class act.
